author: m.kalinin
content: One of potential solutions is to subsidise a portion of PoW blocks going beyond the transition block. And pay reward for these blocks on docked eth1 chain (that is, secured by PoS). Thus, incentivise miners to stay as long as it's needed for sustainable docking. There is an option to subsidise only those blocks that has no transactions to decouple canonical eth1 chain.

author: m.kalinin
content: Eth1 history will become optional when the transition point gets finalized and reaches the boundary of weak subjectivity period. As at that point it won't be needed for consensus. Some parties will highly likely keep maintaining the history to provide their services.

author: m.kalinin
content: That would stop chain progress for this period of time and lead to related services being out. And it doesn't prevent double spend near to the point when empty blocks starts emerge and where eth1 chain would already entered its vulnerable stage if in practice we see this stage at all.

author: m.kalinin
content:
From what I know the state snapshot is way bigger than 1gb. Of course, the full history is much more of that. There is a new proposal about enshrining eth1 execution into the beacon chain (https://ethresear.ch/t/executable-beacon-chain/8271).

Disregarding the particular proposal, validators will keep running their eth1 nodes during the docking. And it won't be necessary to download a specific snapshot to start producing eth1 blocks inside of eth2 system. It should happen seamlessly by switching eth1 node from mainnet mode to eth1-engine mode allowing for new-fashioned eth1 block production and processing.

author: m.kalinin
content: My gut is that there will be no big increase in resource requirements for running eth1 nodes for validators to support eth1 docking. Anyway, this is one of the considerations and we'll get more understanding on that part when get closer to the docking procedure.

author: m.kalinin
content: FYI, Phase 1 has been decomposed to a number of upgrades. Light client and shards are being separated now and there are more changes on the list. The new proposal (that is, executable beacon chain) makes docking independent from shards. So, in the current vision there is no Phase 1 and Phase 1.5 as they were previously.
